document_name_accent: ung thu co tu cung giai doan 1.json
document_title: Cervical cancer stage I (early stage): Symptoms and treatment
subsection_name: ung-thu-co-tu-cung-giai-doan-1.json_1_Stages in stage I cervical cancer according to the FIGO classification
subsection_content:
Cervical cancer stage IA
In stage IA, the tumor growth is so small that it can only be seen under a microscope. (2)
This stage can be divided into 2 subgroups:
Cervical cancer stage IA1: Lesion depth < 3mm.
Cervical cancer stage IA2: Damage depth is from 3 - 5mm.
Cervical cancer stage IB
At this stage, the tumor is larger in size but is still limited to the cervix and has not metastasized far.
This stage can be divided into 3 groups:
Cervical cancer stage IB1: Lesions are ≥ 5mm deep and < 2cm wide; Cervical cancer stage IB2: Lesions have a depth of ≥ 5mm and a width of 2 - 5cm.; Cervical cancer stage IB3: Lesions are ≥ 4cm wide.
See more:
Cervical cancer stage II; Cervical cancer stage III; Cervical cancer stage IV
subsection_title: ung thu co tu cung giai doan 1.json. Stages in stage I cervical cancer according to the FIGO classification
